| History                 = The '''Homines Verendi''' was an anti-mutant organization created and led by former members of the [[Inner Circle]] of the [[Hellfire Club (Earth-616)|Hellfire Club]], [[Kade Kilgore (Earth-616)|Kade Kilgore]], [[Wilhelmina Kensington (Earth-616)|Wilhelmina Kensington]], [[Manuel Enduque (Earth-616)|Manuel Enduque]], and [[Maximilian Frankenstein (Earth-616)|Maximilian Frankenstein]], who also recruited Taiwanese billionaire and anti-mutant activist, [[Chen Zhao (Earth-616)|Chen Zhao]].{{r|Marauders Vol 1 4}}{{r|Marauders Vol 1 6}}

One of their plans to make mutantkind hurt consisted of buying the healing drugs of [[Krakoa (Earth-616)|Krakoa]] from the black market and replacing them with poisonous drugs, so they could accuse mutants of trying to kill humans,{{r|Marauders Vol 1 7}} but, thanks to the intelligence of [[Delores Ramirez (Earth-616)|Delores Ramirez]], the mutants were able to switch the drugs before they were given to the people, making Homines Verendi unwillingly help save numerous lives and waste millions in the black market.{{r|Marauders Vol 1 11}}

On a different front, the Verendi were trying to raze the lowtown of Madripoor to build more towers and get even richer, so the Hellfire Trading Corporation outbid them in buying multiple porperties to ensure the safety of the people, including the creation of a free hospital for everyone. Revolted with this affront, the Verendi then unleashed an all-new team of [[Reavers (Earth-616)|Reavers]], composed of biomechanically augmented mercs and criminals recently maimed by mutants, against the [[Marauders (Pryde) (Earth-616)|Marauders]], successfuly causing an international incident that resulted in the Marauders being banned from Madripoor.{{r|Marauders Vol 1 17|18}}

With their protectors gone, the people of Lowtown were pillaged and had their houses destroyed by the Reavers, but the Marauders sent a small team of [[Morlocks (Earth-616)|Morlocks]] into the city to fight the Reavers and keep the peope safe one more day.{{r|Marauders Vol 1 19}}
